summary: This document is an email chain from April 2021 between FBI personnel and contractors regarding technical issues with copying files from a CD containing Maxwell-related materials. The emails discuss a corrupted folder named '1B 1-14' that needs to be replaced, with plans to upload files via USAfx or create a new disc.

persons.name: Special Agent FBI New York Field Office
persons.context: The sender of the top email in the chain, responding to a request about uploading files and mentioning issues with a USAfx account and plans to drop off media.

events.title: CD with Maxwell files received
events.description: The FBI brought a CD containing additional files for review in the Maxwell case to an office on the 4th floor.
personsInvolved: Special Agent FBI New York Field Office

events.title: File transfer issues with CD
events.description: Attempts to copy files from the CD encountered problems, specifically with a folder named '1B 1-14' that may be corrupted, requiring a replacement or alternative transfer method.
personsInvolved: Special Agent FBI New York Field Office

keyFacts: In April 2021, the FBI possessed a CD with additional files related to the Ghislaine Maxwell case that needed to be reviewed.
Technical issues arose when copying files from the CD, specifically with a folder named '1B 1-14', which was potentially corrupted.
The email chain involves coordination between FBI personnel and contractors to resolve the file transfer issue, considering options like USAfx upload or burning a new disc.
The document shows ongoing investigative activity and evidence handling in the Maxwell case years after the initial arrests.
Multiple individuals are mentioned but their names are redacted, indicating sensitivity around the personnel involved in evidence processing.
